result.execSummary:
All charges against Peter W Blaser in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Peter W Blaser is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter W Blaser

records.addlTxt: 1:02 PM Defendant Peter W Blaser appeared by video.  Attorney Terry L. Nussberger in court for Peter W Blaser.  Attorney Emily Margaret Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Nussberger believes case may be set for Plea/Sentencing. Set for June 27, 2022 @ 04:00PM. Adj 1:03PM

8:59 AM Defendant Peter W Blaser in court.  Attorney Terry L. Nussberger in court for Peter W Blaser.  Attorney Emily Margaret Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 21CF89, 22CF26.  ADA Nelson has spoken to Barron county on a open case for DE, that case was dismissed in Barron therefore the State moves to dismiss 22CF26. Court will dismiss.  State has made an offer to parties, set for RH May 6, 2022 @ 1:00PM.  Parties may appear via ZOOM if a RH, in person if plea. Adj 9:04am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 09:04 AM Defendant Peter W Blaser in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger.  Emily Margaret Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 21CF89-RH and 22CF26-Init App.   22CF26- Waive formal reading of the CC. State recommends sign bond be concurrent with 21CF89,   Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.   No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.  DE will waive TL for PH, court instructs on Waiver, DE understands waiver, court will accept waiver of TL.  Set for RH/PH May 3, 2022 @ 9:00AM. Adj 9:09AM
Preliminary hearing on May 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
